episode_summary: This episode of 'No Such Thing As A Fish' covers a variety of quirky and historical facts, including an awards ceremony for award makers, Napoleon's love for roast chicken, the origins of IMDB, and the etymology of the word 'fascinate'. The hosts delve into these topics with humor and interesting anecdotes, exploring the peculiarities of history and modern culture.

facts.fact: Las Vegas hosts an awards ceremony for people who make awards.
Napoleon loved roast chicken so much that his household chefs were constantly cooking some in case he decided he wanted any.
IMDB was originally just a list of actresses with beautiful eyes.
The word fascinate literally means the embodiment of the divine phallus.
